docs.text: as i write the review for the new hanks/ryan romantic comedy you've got mail , i am acutely aware that i am typing it on a computer and sending it a billion miles away on the internet .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i am also aware that i have just spent the last 2 hours watching the world's biggest paid commercial for america online .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and i wonder : is that so bad ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: well , the commercial part is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as for the movie , well , as long as i can watch tom hanks and meg ryan , i think i'll be okay .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to paraphrase james berardinelli , whose reviews i admire very much , tom hanks and meg ryan can act .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they are both wonderful , but for all of hanks' glorious work in serious films , such as his magnificent performance in saving private ryan , and his glorious triumph in philadelphia , i like him best when he's suitably obnoxious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tom hanks is wonderful when he is obnoxious in a romantic comedy when he's going to get the girl : the only question is how ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: meg ryan , america's high school sweetheart , can act .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she's had a handful of memorable performances , including the great scene in the diner in when harry met sally ( i must not mention what she does , due to the , well , um , you get the idea , and if you don't , get the movie-- fantastic ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but , i like her best when she's , well , perky .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is so adorably perky/cute that together with hanks , they are the most amazing onscreen duo in my short lifetime .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some people have them going back to really old classic romantic couples , but i don't really know .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all i know is that i just like them both .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they have such wonderfully kinetic chemistry that's really hard to resist , and i'm not going to even try .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they're just really , really cute , sweet , and charming .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hanks and ryan collaborate once again with nora ephron , who directed them in the megahit sleepless in seattle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here , the setup is a little different .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kathleen kelly ( ryan ) owns a small children's bookstore which her mother founded 42 years ago and passed down to her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is successful , beautiful , and dates a well-known columnist with very radical idea ( kinnear ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is also having an affair , of sorts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you see , kathleen , with the handle shopgirl , is secretly emailing ny152 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they have a strictly un-detailed relationship : there are no specifics , and they have no idea who each other is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ny152 happens to be joe fox ( hanks ) , a multimillionaire bookseller who is the heir to the fortune of the fox chain of mega-bookstores , run by his father ( coleman ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fox books has decided to open a store on the west side , right across from a little children's bookseller named " shop around the corner " , run by a perky girl named kathleen kelly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every morning , these two email each other silly , and every day , they fight " to the death ! ! " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a charming premise , and one that works nicely , balancing the immense troubles kathleen is in with the romance she wants to have .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it also has the great sense of being a classic romance : there is no " let's have sex tonight " mantra , if you'll excuse my bluntness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a solid romance built around that vague concept of love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hmm . well , the movie goes through twists and turns , having some sad moments and happy ones , until at one moment tom hanks and meg ryan " hook up " , to use modern terminology , and kiss their way into happiness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you know it's going to happen , the question is now ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: thankfully , ephron has a wonderful supporting cast with posey , kinnear , chappelle , and a host of others , including a great scene involving brothers , aunts , and two sweet kids .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's all cute and wonderful , and for all of the idealism , it makes me feel good .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hanks is as obnoxious as ever on the outside and as warm on the inside as he always is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is , i believe , america's greatest actor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: does he show it here ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nah .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but he's still tom hanks , and she's still meg ryan .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: which is what this movie boils down to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's pure confection .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all the bits about the godfather , the jokes , the superb script , it's all really sweet .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are some immense flaws , like pacing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the last third of the movie really doesn't work as well as i would have liked , and for a romantic comedy , it's slow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: once hanks knows the secret , it gets really slow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i even looked at my watch a couple times , to make sure ephron was going to deliver the big onscreen kiss i was waiting for , so that i could get home at a reasonable hour .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the other problem is that this movie is shaping up to be really dated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: e-mail ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when my kids are my age , i don't know what we'll be using .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but hanks can do more with one eyeroll than anybody , and meg ryan just loves to dive into a pillow better than anyone in movie history .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they just work together , and it's nice to see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it gives you , well , a smile .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the script helps with some great lines that are absolutely hilarious , and that always come at the exact right time to keep the audience awake .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i was arguing with my father on the drive back home on what the purpose of movies was .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i've always believed that movies are very powerful , very powerful indeed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you see , mankind has three abilities he needs to survive : the ability to think , entertain , and procreate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: movies can definitely do the first two , and as for the third , well , i'd rather not think about that .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i always thought films that made you think enlightened you and made you see something from another viewpoint , and that films that entertained you were good , because you forgot about your troubles and thought about something nice for a night .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and i was thinking about how incredible a year tom hanks has had .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hanks was the driving force behind one of the year's best films in saving private ryan , which is one of those thinking films that truly made someone wonder about the world .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's also half of the glue behind the year's best example of pure entertainment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tom hanks and meg ryan are magical , as is this movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a sweet , lovely affair with a technology twist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it may be a long commercial , but it gave me a pretty big smile on my face .
docs.label: positive
